meanings.definition: (verb) To be stranded on a sandbank by a receding tide.
meanings.sent1: The boat was neaped on the sandbank as the tide went out.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen found themselves neaped on the shore when the water retreated.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls laughed at the neaped boat, unable to move with the low tide.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of adventure were neaped on the shore, waiting for the tide to return.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of being neaped on the sandbank was both frustrating and peaceful.

meanings.definition: (adjective) Left aground on a sandbank by a receding tide.
meanings.sent1: The neaped boat sat abandoned on the shore, waiting for the water to come back.
meanings.sent2: The neaped sailors waved for help from the stranded vessel.
meanings.sent3: The neaped ship looked like a lonely island in the middle of the beach.
meanings.sent4: The neaped beach chairs seemed to long for the warmth of the sun once more.
meanings.sent5: The neaped sandbank held secrets of the sea, revealed only when the tide was high.
